collections.name: CityIndex.TradingAPI
collections.description:
The first part of the CIAPI uses the software architecture style of Representational State Transfer (REST). This is one of the standard web service methods to communicate over the internet with remote servers.

The CIAPI RESTful implementation uses the Secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTPS) for communication between our back-end and your trading solution (client UI application). Request / response calls initiated by the client UI application must follow a simplified RESTful pattern supporting GET and POST, and encoding data in JavaScript object notation (JSON).

Typically, requests for information such as: available markets, historical prices, and account history are exposed via HTTPS GET requests. Requests that change state such as: placing a trade or logging on are performed using HTTPS POST.

requests.name: ListFollowers
requests.description:
Lists the followers of the specified CI Connect users. (Service call used by the CI Connect social trading platform.)

Note: this requires an existence of the respective CI Connect user record in the CI Connect database.

responseCode.name: OK
responseCode.detail: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

requests.name: GetPriceBars
requests.description:
Get historic price bars for the specified market in OHLC (open, high, low, close) format, suitable for plotting in candlestick charts. Returns price bars in ascending order up to the current time. When there are no prices for a particular time period, no price bar is returned. Thus, it can appear that the array of price bars has "gaps", i.e. the gap between the date & time of each price bar might not be equal to interval x span.

Sample Urls:

    /market/1234/history?interval=MINUTE&span=15&PriceBars=180
    /market/735/history?interval=HOUR&span=1&PriceBars=240
    /market/1577/history?interval=DAY&span=1&PriceBars=10
    
Parameters

        MarketId 	string 	The ID of the market.
        interval 	string 	The pricebar interval.
        span 	    integer The number of each interval per pricebar.
        PriceBars 	integer The total number of price bars to return. 
        priceType 	string 	The price type being requested. If left blank then the default setting returns the MID price. Possible values are: ASK, MID, BID.
        
The following request to the Live CIAPI environment retrieves the 20 most recent 15 minute Bid price bars for the Wall Street CFD market (Market ID = 99498). HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

headers.name: X-Px
headers.value: ms h0-s2005.p0-mow ( h0-s56.p6-lhr), ms h0-s56.p6-lhr ( origin)

requests.name: SearchWithTags GTS
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. This search extends ListMarketSearch by optionally searching within a specified market tag and only returning matching markets from the specified tag. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the summarised MarketId and MarketName properties.

The market tag is optional and if not used, then this service call will behave the same as ListMarketSearch. The list of market tag IDs are provided in the table at Market Tag IDs.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" within the "Commodities" market tag (96), and returns the first ten results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the search results in JSON format (MarketInformationSearchWithTagsResponseDTO).

requests.name: ListMarketSentiments
requests.description:
Gets a list of market sentiments for the specified market IDs. The sentiment for each market is derived from registered CI Connect members only.
(Service call used by the CI Connect social trading platform.)

requests.name: GetWallItemsForUsers
requests.description:
Fetches the wall items for the specified screen names. (Service call used by the CI Connect social trading platform.)

Note: this requires an existence of the respective CI Connect user record in the CI Connect database.

requests.name: FullSearchWithTags GTS
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. This search extends ListMarketInformationSearch by optionally searching within a specified market tag and only returning matching markets from the specified tag. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the full ApiMarketInformationDTO.

The market tag is optional and if not used, then this service call will behave the same as ListMarketInformationSearch. The list of market tag IDs are provided in the table at Market Tag IDs.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" within the "Commodities" market tag (96), and returns the first ten results. The full market information is returned for all search results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing market information for the search results in JSON format (FullMarketInformationSearchWithTagsResponseDTO).

requests.name: GetSystemLookup
requests.description:
Use the message lookup service to get localised text names for the various status codes & IDs returned by the API. For example, a query for OrderStatusReason will contain text names for all the possible values of OrderStatusReason in the ApiOrderResponseDTO. You should only request the list once per session (for each entity you're interested in).

The entity to lookup:

    OrderStatusReason, InstructionStatusReason, OrderApplicability, Currency, QuoteStatus, QuoteStatusReason or Culture.

requests.name: ListMarketSearch GTS
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. The search can be performed by market code and/or market name, and can include CFDs and Spread Bet markets. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the summarised MarketId and MarketName properties.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" and returns the first ten search results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the search results in JSON format (ListMarketSearchResponseDTO).

requests.name: ListCfdMarkets
requests.description:
Returns a list of CFD markets filtered by market name and/or market code. Leave the market name and code parameters empty to return all markets available to the User.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment retrieves the list of CFD markets matching the following search criteria: market name contains "Gold", a maximum of 20 results returned, and use the short form of the market name.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the market list information in JSON format (AccountInformationResponseDTO).

requests.name: ChangePassword
requests.description:
Change a user's password.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment changes the DM123456 account password from "allsystemsgo" to "openthedoor".

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body is the ApiSaveAccountInformationResponseDTO in JSON format.

requests.name: ListMarketSearch
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. The search can be performed by market code and/or market name, and can include CFDs and Spread Bet markets. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the summarised MarketId and MarketName properties.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" and returns the first ten search results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the search results in JSON format (ListMarketSearchResponseDTO).

responseCode.name: OK
responseCode.detail: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

requests.name: FullSearchWithTags
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. This search extends ListMarketInformationSearch by optionally searching within a specified market tag and only returning matching markets from the specified tag. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the full ApiMarketInformationDTO.

The market tag is optional and if not used, then this service call will behave the same as ListMarketInformationSearch. The list of market tag IDs are provided in the table at Market Tag IDs.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" within the "Commodities" market tag (96), and returns the first ten results. The full market information is returned for all search results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing market information for the search results in JSON format (FullMarketInformationSearchWithTagsResponseDTO).

requests.name: ListMarketInformationSearch GTS
requests.description:
Returns market information for the markets that meet the search criteria. The search can be performed by market code and/or market name, and can include CFDs and Spread Bet markets.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" and returns the market information for the first ten.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.
Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the market information for the search results (ListMarketInformationResponseDTO).

requests.name: GetMarketInformation
requests.description:
Get Market Information for the single specified market supplied in the parameter.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment retrieves the market information for Gold DFT, which has the ID 400616377. HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the market information for the requested market in JSON format (AccountInformationResponseDTO).

requests.name: ListMarketSearchPaginated GTS
requests.description:
Returns a markets page containing a list of markets that meet the search criteria. The search can be performed by market code and/or market name, and can include CFDs and Spread Bet markets. This method differs from ListMarketSearch in that the returned results are paginated.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" and returns the first 20 results. The results are shown as 5 markets per page starting from page 1.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the paginated search results in JSON format (ListMarketSearchPaginatedResponseDTO).

requests.name: LogOn
requests.description:
Create a new session. This is how you "log on" to the CIAPI.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment logs in to your account using the example credentials of Username as "DM123456" and password as "openthedoor".

The AppKey required to use the CIAPI is sent to you once you have returned the signed terms and conditions of the CIAPI to our Partnerships team:

    (PartnershipServices[at]cityindex.com).

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body is the ApiLogOnResponseDTO in JSON format.

requests.name: SearchWithTags
requests.description:
Returns a list of markets that meet the search criteria. This search extends ListMarketSearch by optionally searching within a specified market tag and only returning matching markets from the specified tag. Leave the query string empty to return all markets available to the user. The results contain the summarised MarketId and MarketName properties.

The market tag is optional and if not used, then this service call will behave the same as ListMarketSearch. The list of market tag IDs are provided in the table at Market Tag IDs.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" within the "Commodities" market tag (96), and returns the first ten results.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the search results in JSON format (MarketInformationSearchWithTagsResponseDTO).

requests.name: SaveAccountInformation
requests.description:
Saves changes to the users account information. Currently only the user email address in the account information can be changed and saved.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment saves a change to the user account information (email address change).

Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body is the ApiSaveAccountInformationResponseDTO in JSON format.

An (empty) response to indicate that the save account information operation has completed.

requests.name: ListMarketInformation
requests.description:
Retrieve the Market Information for the markets in the specified list of market IDs.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment requests the market information for the markets in the following list:
UK 100 DFT (400616113)
UK 100 CFD (99500)
GBP/USD DFT (400616150)
EUR/USD CFD (154290)
 
Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body is the ApiTradeOrderResponseDTO in JSON format.

headers.name: X-Px
headers.value: nc h0-s1035.p11-fra ( h0-s56.p6-lhr), nc h0-s56.p6-lhr ( origin)

requests.name: ListMarketInformationSearch
requests.description:
Returns market information for the markets that meet the search criteria. The search can be performed by market code and/or market name, and can include CFDs and Spread Bet markets.

Note: when searching for currency markets by name enter the format as "USD JPY" or "GBP USD". Do not use the "/" in the name of the currency pair.

The following request to the Live CIAPI environment searches for markets with names matching the query string "Gold" and returns the market information for the first ten.
HTTP GET does not use the body. Parameters should be added in the query string.
Note: the authentication UserName and Session token are not shown in the example for the purposes of clarity, but they are required in the actual query string.

A successful request results in an HTTP 200 code in the response header, and the response body containing the market information for the search results (ListMarketInformationResponseDTO).
